data.name: Bulbasaur
data.flavorText: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

data.name: Venusaur
data.flavorText: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

abilities.name: Floral Fragrance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Ivysaur
data.flavorText: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower's coming bloom.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Carnivine
data.flavorText: It binds itself to trees on marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

attacks.name: Lure Poison
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Spit Squall
attacks.text: Your opponent puts the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her hand.

data.name: Leafeon
data.flavorText: It basically does not fight. With cells similar to those of plants, it can perform photosynthesis.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Crustle
data.flavorText: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.

attacks.name: Heavy Bullet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dwebble
data.flavorText: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.

data.name: Karrablast
data.flavorText: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Shelmet
data.flavorText: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Accelgor
data.flavorText: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

attacks.name: Deck and Cover
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.name: Flareon
data.flavorText: Inhaled air is heated in the flame sac in its body to an intense fire over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Sand-Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fire Slash
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Entei-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Combusken
data.flavorText: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Torchic
data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Torchic
data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F.

data.name: Torkoal
data.flavorText: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Heatmor
data.flavorText: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.

attacks.name: Hot Lick
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Durant, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Blaziken
data.flavorText: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch it foes.

attacks.name: Blaze Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. When it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Volcarona
data.flavorText: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.

abilities.name: Scorching Scales
abilities.text: Put 4 damage counters instead of 2 on your opponent's Burned Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Burning Wind
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Slowbro
data.flavorText: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.

abilities.name: Airhead
abilities.text: If you have 2, 4, or 6 Prize Cards left, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Lazy Headbutt
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.

attacks.name: Big Yawn
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Shot in the Dark
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Vaporeon
data.flavorText: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can melt away into water.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Kyogre-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Piplup
data.flavorText: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Prinplup
data.flavorText: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Glaceon
data.flavorText: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Tympole
data.flavorText: They warn other of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Empoleon
data.flavorText: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.

abilities.name: Diving Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 1 card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Attack Command
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Palpitoad
data.flavorText: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Vanillite
data.flavorText: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas surrounding them.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Ducklett
data.flavorText: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food—peat moss.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Vanillish
data.flavorText: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon's habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Swanna
data.flavorText: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

attacks.name: Healing Dance
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Incessant Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Jolteon
data.flavorText: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.

attacks.name: Electrigun
attacks.text: You may discard a Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Raikou-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Minun
data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

attacks.name: Negative Ion
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Electrishower
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Plusle
data.flavorText: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

attacks.name: Tag Draw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If Minun is on your Bench, draw 4 more cards.

attacks.name: Positive Ion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

data.name: Galvantula
data.flavorText: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Electrisilk
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has no Retreat Cost, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Eelektross
data.flavorText: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.

attacks.name: Suction Heal
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slurp Shakedown
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Eelektrik
data.flavorText: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Slowking
data.flavorText: Being bitten by Shellder gave it intelligence comparable to that of award-winning scientists.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hand Press
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Tynamo
data.flavorText: These Pokémon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Espeon
data.flavorText: Its fur is so sensitive, it can sense minute shifts in the air and predict the weather.

abilities.name: Solar Revelation
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to each of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Psy Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

data.name: Aerodactyl
data.flavorText: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Old Amber Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Ancient Scream
abilities.text: Your Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a card at random from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

data.name: Woobat
data.flavorText: Suction from its nostrils enables it to stick to cave walls during sleep. It leaves a heart-shaped mark behind.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cofagrigus
data.flavorText: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.

attacks.name: Chuck
attacks.text: Discard as many Pokémon Tool cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 40 damage times the number of cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Groudon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tromp
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Giant Claw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

attacks.name: Tunnel Strike
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dig Uppercut
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Drilbur
data.flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

data.name: Timburr
data.flavorText: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.

data.name: Gurdurr
data.flavorText: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.

attacks.name: Steel Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Excadrill
data.flavorText: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

attacks.name: Reinforced Drill
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Umbreon
data.flavorText: When exposed to the moon's aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.

attacks.name: Shadow Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.name: Darkrai-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dark Cloak
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Darkness Energy attached to it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Night Spear
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

attacks.name: Sand Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Umbreon
data.flavorText: When exposed to the moon's aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Shadow Shutdown
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard all Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Junk Hunt
attacks.text: Put 2 Item cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

data.name: Krookodile
data.flavorText: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Bombast
attacks.text: Does 40 damage times the number of Prize cards you have taken.

data.name: Scraggy
data.flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Scrafty
data.flavorText: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Zoroark
data.flavorText: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

attacks.name: Brutal Bash
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Darkness Pokémon you have in play.

attacks.name: Dark Rush
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Escavalier
data.flavorText: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.

attacks.name: Joust
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cavalry Lance
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.name: Klink
data.flavorText: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Vullaby
data.flavorText: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Klang
data.flavorText: Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don't return.

attacks.name: Charge Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Klinklang
data.flavorText: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.

attacks.name: Metal Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lock Gear
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: They fight at Bisharp's command. They cling to their prey and inflict damage by sinking their blades into it.

data.name: Chansey
data.flavorText: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Chansey
data.flavorText: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Blissey
data.flavorText: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

abilities.name: Softboiled
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, heal 30 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 60 damage to itself.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Because its genetic makeup is irregular, it quickly changes its form due to a variety of causes.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Because its genetic makeup is irregular, it quickly changes its form due to a variety of causes.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Lillipup
data.flavorText: The long hair around its face provides an amazing radar that lets it sense subtle changes in its surroundings.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Chatot
data.flavorText: Its tongue is just like a human's. As a result, it can cleverly mimic human speech.

attacks.name: Tone-Deaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Haxorus
data.flavorText: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

attacks.name: Stunning Uppercut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Dark Claw
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If this card is attached to a Darkness Pokémon, each of the attacks of that Pokémon does 20 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Stoutland
data.flavorText: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.

attacks.name: Special Fang
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Ferocious Bellow
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Tornadus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blow Through
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Cheren
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Herdier
data.flavorText: It has a black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Dark Patch
rules: Attach a basic Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Darkness Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Enhanced Hammer
rules: Discard a Special Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hooligans Jim & Cas
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 3 random cards from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals those cards and shuffles them into his or her deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: N
rules: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a card for each of his or her remaining Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Old Amber Aerodactyl
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Aerodactyl you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Juniper
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Random Receiver
rules: Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a Supporter card. Put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Twist Mountain
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may flip a coin. If heads, that player may play a Restored Pokémon from their hand onto their Bench.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Entei-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Raikou-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Groudon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tromp
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Giant Claw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Darkrai-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dark Cloak
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Darkness Energy attached to it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Night Spear
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Kyogre-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Switch your opponent's Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Gardevoir
data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

abilities.name: Psychic Mirage
abilities.text: Each basic Psychic Energy attached to your Psychic Pokémon provides PsychicPsychic Energy. You can't apply more than 1 Psychic Mirage Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Archeops
data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

abilities.name: Ancient Power
abilities.text: Each play can't play any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve his or her Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Tornadus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blow Through
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.
